snippet: Witnesses said that the finish line, normally a festive site of celebration and exhaustion, suddenly felt like a battlefield.
abstract: Boston Marathon is jarred by two explosions that turn uplifting day into nightmarish swirl of bloodied streets and torn-apart limbs; runners are toppled, children on sidelines are maimed, and panicked city watches its iconic athletic spectacle destroyed as normally festive finish line is suddenly like war zone; Boston hospitals struggle to keep up with flow of patients.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by John Eligon and Mary Pilon in Boston, and Steve Eder, Kirk Semple and Andrew W. Lehren in New York.

lead_paragraph: Witnesses said that the finish line, normally a festive site of celebration and exhaustion, suddenly felt like a battlefield.

headline.seo: Witnesses Describe Scene After Blasts at Boston Marathon
headline.main: War Zone at Mile 26: ‘So Many People Without Legs’
headline.print_headline: War Zone at Mile 26: ‘So Many People Without Legs’
